org.usfirst.frc.team302.robot.utilities

Class AngularMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team302.robot.utilities.AngularMath

  • public class AngularMath
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will be used to calculate angle targets for our robot. Since the gyro goes from 360 degrees to 0 immediately, the robot needs to know that 359 degrees is really close in position to 0 degrees. This math class is used to find things such as the smallest angle between two positions or the angle you need to go to if you want to turn a certain degree amount. The class recognizes that 0 and 360 are the same position and will give you a 0 degree difference between them.

    Change Log:

    Version:
    version 1:

    1/19/2016 --Derek Witcpalek -- Original implementation of add(), subtract(), and smallestAngle() methods. I also tested the math that this class does and it looked solid.

    Author:
    Derek

                         double changeInAngle)
        This is used to find the angle you are targeting in a clockwise rotation
        Parameters:
        currentAngle - The starting angle of the robot
        changeInAngle - How far you want to turn
        Returns:
        TargetAngle Where you should want to end up

      • getSmallestAngle

        private static double getSmallestAngle(double currentAngle,
                                       double targetAngle)
        This method is used to figure out how far you need to turn to get to a specific target angle. It is designed to give you the smallest angle needed to get there so that you choose to rotate the robot the correct direction.
        Parameters:
        currentAngle - The starting angle of the robot
        targetAngle - Where you want to end up
        Returns:
        angleOfRotation How much you must rotate the robot

      • getBestRotationDirection

        private static AngularMath.RotationDirection getBestRotationDirection(double currentAngle,
                                                                      double targetAngle,
                                                                      double smallestAngle)
        This method is used to figure out the direction you should rotate between two angles to have the smallest angle to turn through.
        Parameters:
        currentAngle - The starting angle of the robot
        targetAngle - Where you want to end up
        smallestAngle - --??
        Returns:
        RotationDirection Which way? (Clockwise, counter-clockwise, no rotation)

      • getBestRotationDescriptor

        public static double[] getBestRotationDescriptor(double currentAngle,
                                                 double targetAngle)
        This tells you how far to rotate and in which direction to get to a specific angle.
        Parameters:
        currentAngle - The starting angle of the robot
        targetAngle - Where you want to end up
        Returns:
        Descriptor Array-- first element is angle you must rotate, second element is the direction (denoted by +1 for clockwise, -1 for counter-clockwise, or 0 for no turn)
